reviewText: The documentary is an objecting look at religion in America

I was mesmerized when this series was broadcast on PBS in the early 1990s.
Randall Balmer offers the viewers an inside look at the practices of the Evangelical religions.
It offers a deep look into the beliefs and activities of religious practices many know little about.
I find it as compelling today as when I first saw it 20 years ago.
Mine Eyes Have seen the Glory  is insightful and useful as I study American Evangelicals.  Although they are missional, they tend to lack ecclesiology.

This documentary is fascinating and provides a great look at the evangelical subculture in America. The only downside is that it is a little too "90s" to seem totally up-to-date. Randall Balmer is the top of this field, and this is a great resource for anyone interested in evangelical culture. Very fun.
